Posts.Content: Scrabblelady wrote: I finished my chemo last February and my Herceptin a month ago but my finernails are weak and chipping  with the slightest provocation.  Does anyone have any ideas how I can  grow stronger nails?  Anyne else with this problem?  The funny thing is that during chemo I had no problems with my finger nails.  Chemo only affected my toenails.  Go figure. Dx 5/18/2010, IDC, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 3, 0/5 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Finernails Scrabblelady Trisha-Anne

Posts.Content: Scrabblelady wrote: I'l  be having my mx in July and , I know this sounds silly, but I'm more worried about coping with these dains than I am about losing my breasts.    Needing to be prepared, can you help with with some questions?    What post- surgical cami do you recommend?  Should I get one that has front opening?  Are sde pockets better than vertical pockets for the drains. Does anyone have any opinions about the TLC front opening cami that the ACS sells on their website?   When changing clothes, what do you do with the drains, do they just dangle from you like unwanted appendages?   If they just hang, doesn't that put pressure on the sutures? They make shirts so short now.  Are  the post- surgical camis   longer than most camp or hawaian style shirts that are sold?   How many drains do you come home with after a bilateral , with no reconstrution or TE's.  ( Im  going flat.        Dx 5/18/2010, IDC, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 3, 0/5 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Drains Scrabblelady bigdogmom2

Posts.Title: Hemmorhoids-Ugh Scrabblelady stlrepke

Posts.Content: Scrabblelady wrote: Welcome to all who started chemo in Sept 210.  As we are finishing up our chemo and moving on to our respective next phases of fighting this BC, let's keep in touch.   My last taxol was yesterday ( 2/16) and I'm experiening some mild neuropathy in fingers and toes.  I am looking forward to the day when y nose stops dripping.     Maybe I should buy stock in the Kleenex company!  I see my onc next week and have a page of questions to ask him about how we are going to monitor any recurrences.  Plus, I am anxious to get the ok to resume my vitamins and fish oil.  I'm worried about how herceptin affects the heart function, plus my cholesterol ( which was high when I started chemo) is probably through the roof by now since  I've added beef and  omega-3 eggs to my diet in hopes of raising my rbc & hemocrit.   Dx 5/18/2010, IDC, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 3, 0/5 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Sept Sisters-recovering from chemo Scrabblelady ToriGirl
